Parent.synopsis: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.synopsis: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.

Kid_001.synopsis: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or Halsin's bear

Worg_002.synopsis: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transformed into a bear.
Worg_002.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. teleport S_GOB_WolfPens_Beastmaster_0024. walk down stairs to cage with Worgs5. click on worg 'Tale' behind cage

Beastmaster001.synopsis: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.

AfterRelease_Bear.synopsis: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
AfterRelease_Bear.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game and proceed to TUT level.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 400.31, 33.03, -32.404. Resolve the automatic dialog with illithid power to open the cage's door.5. Stay there for the Bear's dialog to trigger.

Halsin_Following.synopsis: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his bear form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
Halsin_Following.how_to_trigger: Steps to reproduce:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 402.894; 32.458; -274. Use illithid dialog choice to free Halsin.5. Side with him and kill the surrounding goblins (killcombat)6. Talk with Halsin and convince him to join you by accepting his quest.7. Talk with Halsin ih bear form.

Halsin_Following_Elf.synopsis: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his elf form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
Halsin_Following_Elf.how_to_trigger: Steps to reproduce:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 402.894; 32.458; -274. Use illithid dialog choice to free Halsin.5. Side with him and kill the surrounding goblins (killcombat)6. Talk with Halsin and convince him to join you by accepting his quest.7. Participate in fight and wait until Halsin takes enough damage to be reverted into his human form.7. Talk with Halsin.

Kid_002.synopsis: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.

Beastmaster002.synopsis: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.synopsis: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  freed from the goblins and changes back from bear form, thanking the players. They can ask him about their tadpole problem, but he wants help saving the grove first - either by killing the goblin leadership or defending the grove, whichever is applicable. The player can insist on learning what they can from him to help with their tadpole, if they wish.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.how_to_trigger:
goto 393; -45

roll amazingWalk toward the cage on the top rightIn the dialogue -  Choices : 1 - 4

Choose to attack the goblins and kill them.Talk to Halsin after the combat in wolf pens in the goblin camp.

GroupDialogWithBear.synopsis: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
GroupDialogWithBear.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 400 -374. Approach the group before the Bear's cage (prison)

CombatCutscene_Bear.synopsis: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. The bear attacks the door that flies away and potentially kill a goblin.

Worg_001.synopsis: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transofrmed into a bear.
Worg_001.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. teleport S_GOB_WolfPens_Beastmaster_0024. walk down stairs to cage with Worgs5. click on worg "Ferr" behind cage

reasoning: The session 'HalsinsBear_AfterCombat' must follow 'Halsin_Following' or 'Halsin_Following_Elf' because it occurs after Halsin is freed from the goblins.
The session 'AfterRelease_Bear' must follow 'HalsinsBear_AfterCombat' because it addresses the aftermath of releasing Halsin from his bear form.
The session 'CombatCutscene_Bear' represents a combat scene that occurs when the bear (Halsin) is released, thus it should occur before 'HalsinsBear_AfterCombat' and 'AfterRelease_Bear'.
The sessions 'Halsin_Following' and 'Halsin_Following_Elf' are mutually exclusive as they represent different forms of Halsin (bear vs elf) and cannot coexist in the same narrative path.

Parent_0.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent_0.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

Parent_1.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent_1.text: Come to see the bear? Just wait 'til Boss Ragzlin sets the worgs on it.
Parent_1.context: NodeContext: Polite in the come to see the traitor node, rude in the other one. She doesn't want to be bothered.

Parent_2.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent_2.context: NodeContext: Polite in the come to see the traitor node, rude in the other one. She doesn't want to be bothered.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage_0.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage_0.text: Get rid of them. Release me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage_1.context: NodeContext: SFX only - Halsin in bear form. Do not voice record.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage_3.context: NodeContext: SFX only - Halsin in bear form. Do not voice record.

Kid_001_0.speaker: One
Kid_001_0.text: D'you think it's bad to keep throwing stones at a dead lump?
Kid_001_0.context: NodeContext: curious, a bit naughty. She doesn't think it's bad at all.

Kid_001_1.speaker: One
Kid_001_1.text: Throw a stone - see if it growls!

Worg_002_0.speaker: Tale
Worg_002_0.text: Fur. Can't you smell the fur? Fur and meat. Lots of MEAT!

Worg_002_1.speaker: Tale
Worg_002_1.text: Meat, Meat. Let me TEAR it up!

Worg_002_2.speaker: Tale
Worg_002_2.text: Out. OUT. Out and RIP it apart.
Worg_002_2.context: NodeContext: Wants to eat the bear

Beastmaster001_0.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001_0.text: Damned booyahg. 'Least he's done with his tricks, now.
Beastmaster001_0.context: NodeContext: BOO-yawg. (w is silent, as in yawn). Said after a bear turned into an elf, and killed a goblin. In turn, the elf was killed.

Beastmaster001_2.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001_2.text: 'Ere to see the bear? Just follow the noise. Worgs 'ave been goin' crazy for it.
Beastmaster001_2.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - worgs are not acting their usual selves.

Beastmaster001_1.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001_1.text: Just hope these scraps will satisfy the bunch when they're in this state.

Beastmaster001_3.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001_3.text: Too bad we had to hand everyone at the tavern over to Moonrise Towers - would've been a real feast for the beasts otherwise.

AfterRelease_Bear_5.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with animals line

AfterRelease_Bear_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

AfterRelease_Bear_2.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear_6.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Bear hostile to player & goblins

AfterRelease_Bear_4.speaker: Player
AfterRelease_Bear_4.text: Leave the bear to the goblins' mercy.

AfterRelease_Bear_0.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear_8.speaker: Narrator
AfterRelease_Bear_8.text: *The bear sizes you up, wary, but not yet attacking.*

Halsin_Following_4.speaker: Player
Halsin_Following_4.text: Gesture for him to wait here.

Halsin_Following_2.speaker: GROUP_VO_HalsinBear
Halsin_Following_2.text: Those ringleaders still draw breath. We must end them.
Halsin_Following_2.context: NodeContext: Halsin in his bear form, spoken to using SwA. More animalistic than usual, on the hunt.

Halsin_Following_0.speaker: GROUP_VO_HalsinBear
Halsin_Following_0.context: NodeContext: Halsin in his bear form, spoken to using SwA.

Halsin_Following_Elf_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf_1.text: The ringleaders of these butchers still draw breath. Nobody is safe until we stop them.

Halsin_Following_Elf_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf_0.text: Hurry, please. Any delay could cost innocents' lives.

Kid_002_0.speaker: Three
Kid_002_0.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002_0.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

Kid_002_1.speaker: Three
Kid_002_1.text: Look, look! I told ya it squealed!

Beastmaster002_0.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002_0.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Beastmaster002_1.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002_1.text: Hands off. This one's for the pups.
Beastmaster002_1.context: NodeContext: Not very threathening. He's just warning you, but he isn't hostile.

Beastmaster002_2.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002_2.text: Guess we ought to cut it into worg meat like the others.
Beastmaster002_2.context: NodeContext: They just killed the bear. He's not looking forward to cutting more meat.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_35.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_35.text: Where are you going? We have work to do - enemies to kill.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_121.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_121.text: Of course. Let's focus on that.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_68.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_68.text: This will have to wait for now.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_195.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_195.text: I'll wait here. Just know that you're gambling with the grove's very existence.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_303.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_303.text: The other leaders are dead, but Minthara has left for the grove.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_72.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_72.text: Nature's blessings. Are you ready to do what is necessary?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_254.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_254.text: Tell me what you know about Moonrise Towers.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_96.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_96.text: The grove is counting on us.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_128.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_128.text: The ringleaders have to die. The very natural order of things is in danger, thanks to them.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_11.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_11.text: Come with me. I could use your help.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_172.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_172.text: Very well. My claws are yours.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_106.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_106.text: All the leaders are dead - the grove's safe.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_192.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_192.text: You did it. You actually did it! The leaders dead - praise Silvanus.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_192.context: InternalNodeContext: Disable his dialogue, he then disappears, appears in the Grove and gets a new dialogueNodeContext: Jubilant. The leaders of the horde threatening his home have been eliminated.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_101.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_101.text: No, that's not right - praise you, my friend. The grove owes you a debt beyond measure.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_41.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_41.text: Killing's never my first choice, but those three were too dangerous to leave alive.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_115.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_115.text: Thank me not, the slaughter was a pleasure.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_119.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_119.text: You sound all but deranged by blood, but I suppose even a feral wolf has a caring hound at heart.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_107.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_107.text: I've done my part - now tell me about Moonrise.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_308.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_308.text: Let's get out of this pit, firstly.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_244.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_244.text: I have some matters to settle, then I'll join you at your camp. There, we can talk properly.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_198.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_198.text: Return to the grove; I'll make my own way there.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_304.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_304.text: And you'll receive it. I'll make my way to your camp, as soon as I've settled some matters.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_56.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_56.text: And you'll receive it soon enough. Return to the grove; I'll make my own way there.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_273.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_273.text: Not so hasty, friend. With the goblins' leaders dead, I can help you. I'll come to your camp, once I've settled some matters.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_125.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_125.text: I'll make my way to the grove - join me there.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_260.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_260.text: Pardon the viscera. One should cherish all of nature's bounty... but goblin guts are quite far down the list.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_260.context: InternalNodeContext: Intro happens only once, that's why Global FlagNodeContext: Hint of wry humour, Introducing himself after transforming from an owlbear and killing several goblins.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_147.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_147.text: Not only do you speak with a bear, but you free it, too? A true friend of nature - or perhaps a lunatic.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_16.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_16.text: You aided a bear without knowing if it would savage you? A true friend of nature - or perhaps a lunatic.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_124.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_124.text: Either way, I owe thanks. I am the druid Halsin.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_52.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_52.text: Glad I could be of help.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_287.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_287.text: I must admit, I didn't expect anyone would come to my aid. Who in their right mind would infiltrate a goblin infested temple. Unless...

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_318.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_318.text: You're Halsin? The Master Halsin of the Emerald Grove?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_274.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_274.text: Yes, but just Halsin will suffice. Unbecoming to demand honorifics from the one who saved my hide.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_54.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_54.text: Well, consider me introduced. And consider me grateful.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_130.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_130.text: I spoke to Nettie - she said you could help me with the parasite in my head.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_141.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_141.text: Parasite in your head...? You mean you have one of them?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_161.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_161.text: I've heard you're an unmatched healer. I need your help.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_142.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_142.text: Impressive healing skills. I need the help of someone like you.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_142.context: InternalNodeContext: Halsin cast a healing spell on himself before this dialogue bagan, If the player doesn't know who he is, this is the reasoning for them asking him to help them.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_134.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_134.text: Indeed? Not the most opportune moment, but given the lengths you went to, I assume there's some urgency.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_138.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_138.text: Come on then, what's the problem? Unless you'd rather wait for an audience of goblins.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_79.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_79.text: I've been to the Emerald Grove. It's in danger.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_252.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_252.text: I am aware. I foolishly left it vulnerable to this rabble. There's work to be done.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_252.context: NodeContext: This rabble - the goblins etc.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_28.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_28.text: You should get out of here. It's not safe.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_196.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_196.text: Oh, I'm quite aware of that, rest assured - but where is safe right now?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_77.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_77.text: ...Hrrm. That look in your eyes - I've seen it before. Are you feeling all right?
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_77.context: NodeContext: switching subject, realizing there is something wrong with you

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_243.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_243.text: Oak Father preserve you, child... You're infected, aren't you? The mind flayers' spawn.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_280.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_280.text: But... something's different. You're aware of the monster inside you. You don't bow to the Absolute, like the True Souls do...
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_280.context: NodeContext: The player's in dire straits, but Halsin can't help but be a little fascinated by their condition, Professional interest,

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_133.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_133.text: I escaped from an illithid ship after being infected. Maybe the process was interrupted.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_95.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_95.text: Perhaps... but I wouldn't want to place all my faith in blind luck.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_202.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_202.text: I think this artefact has something to do with it.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_63.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_63.text: Hmmm... that looks very alien. As alien as the mind flayers. They do not belong on this world.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_245.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_245.text: You weren't speaking lightly when you said you needed help. Let me tell you what I know.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_285.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_285.text: I've been studying these parasites for a while now. Ever since I discovered these so-called True Souls are infected with them.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_92.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_92.text: Someone is using very powerful magic to modify these tadpoles. They are using them to exert control over the infected.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_268.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_268.text: I'm sorry to say, I can't undo that magic, which means I can't cure you. But that doesn't mean I can't help.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_80.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_80.text: I didn't find what I came here for - a way to remove the tadpoles - but I found the next best thing. I found out where they come from.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_232.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_232.text: That must be where these enchantments are placed on them, and it's where you'll find your cure.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_292.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_292.text: Tell me what you've learned about the tadpoles' origins.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_94.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_94.text: I overheard that the cultists are sending all of their captives to Moonrise Towers.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_37.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_37.text: Innocents go in, True Souls come out. Given that all of these True Souls are infected, it has to be the source of this magic.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_222.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_222.text: If you want to find a cure, you must head there and discover how the tadpoles are being manipulated.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_81.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_81.text: You seem to know a lot about this. Will you come with me to Moonrise?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_219.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_219.text: Gladly, but I have some matters to settle first. You go ahead - I'll join you at your camp.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_111.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_111.text: Gladly, but first I must return to the grove. As you made short work of the goblins' leaders, there's nothing stopping me. Come join me in your own time.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_167.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_167.text: I can see to some matters there, and we can discuss what comes next amidst more... bucolic surroundings than here.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_167.context: NodeContext: Halsin would very much like to leave the grim dungeon and go back to his grove.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_301.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_301.text: I wish I could, but there's still work I've yet to finish - blood I've yet to spill.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_208.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_208.text: I've no right to ask more of you... but if you could help me, I'd be free to join your journey to Moonrise.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_208.context: NodeContext: A touch sheepish. We've just freed him, and now he finds he has to ask another favour.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_1.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_1.text: I cannot allow these butchers to threaten my grove. The natural order must be protected.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_1.context: NodeContext: Practical. No lover of violence, but knows when needs must. Gestures at the surrounds on 'these butchers' to refer to the goblins and their allies.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_178.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_178.text: All right. How do I help?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_158.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_158.text: My thanks. If you prevail, I'll owe you the debt of a lifetime.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_297.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_297.text: It's too late to stop things from here - the goblins are already marching on the grove in force.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_227.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_227.text: You must get ahead of them, muster the defences.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_186.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_186.text: Very well. I'll go rescue the grove.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_55.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_55.text: Thank you. I know it's a great deal to ask, but the grove is everything to me.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_45.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_45.text: Hurry, then. I will meet you there.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_288.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_288.text: You ask too much of me. I can't help you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_15.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_15.text: Then the grove is doomed, and perhaps you as well.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_93.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_93.text: I'll pray to Silvanus that you have a change of heart. But time is short.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_151.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_151.text: At least tell me what you know about Moonrise. You owe me, after all.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_0.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_0.text: As you wish. Better I impart the knowledge to you now, in case I fall trying to defend the grove.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_190.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_190.text: I'm not much of a hero... those I look after seem to end up dead.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_300.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_300.text: Death is nature's final slumber - it awaits us all. Do not punish yourself over those lost, or give in to despair - not while there are still folk in need of your help.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_71.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_71.text: Rare is the beast that survives decapitation. Help me eliminate the drow Minthara, the hobgoblin Dror Ragzlin, and that perversion of a priestess, Gut.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_71.context: NodeContext: Giving a list of targets in exchange for his help. D-Roar Rags-lin, Min-Thara

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_7.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_7.text: Look around you - there's no order anymore. Only chaos.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_290.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_290.text: Chaos is welcome, in doses; it helps keep balance. But this is too much - this is unnatural.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_290.context: NodeContext: Emphatic. A matter of great importance for him,

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_69.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_69.text: It's too late to merely kill this horde's leadership - their forces are already marching. If you want me to help, you need to help me first.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_113.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_113.text: Help me kill the leaders of this horde, save my grove. Then I will help you.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_113.context: NodeContext: Practical. No lover of violence, but knows when needs must.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_266.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_266.text: Three deaths could win us peace: the drow Minthara, the hobgoblin Dror Ragzlin, and that perversion of a priestess, Gut.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_168.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_168.text: They are the ones holding these parasites together. Remove them and nature will cure itself.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_168.context: NodeContext: Practical. No lover of violence, but knows when needs must.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_233.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_233.text: Doubtful - I already killed the goblin leadership.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_14.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_14.text: You did...? Nature's found a most furious defender in you.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_14.context: NodeContext: Surprised and impressed. The player has fulfilled a mission before he could issue it.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_118.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_118.text: Very well. Return to the grove. I'll make my own way there - then we can see about this parasite of yours.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_225.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_225.text: Having a shapeshifting bear-druid at my side might make things easier.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_270.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_270.text: I'll deal with this. You get to safety.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_144.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_144.text: I told you, nowhere is safe. Not while this rot festers. Once it is cut out - once the grove is secure - then I shall leave.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_44.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_44.text: There is no safety. Not while this rot festers. Once it is cut out - once the grove is secure - then I shall leave.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_70.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_70.text: Follow me, then. Your bear form may prove useful.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_26.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_26.text: Be warned - my presence could make things more difficult... I can only restrain my bear form so much. I won't be able to help but attack goblins.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_26.context: NodeContext: A warning of sorts - he doesn't want to be a liability.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_25.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_25.text: If I join you, we'll likely have to slaughter this entire place. You may want to use discretion when approaching the goblin leaders.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_25.context: NodeContext: A warning of sorts - he doesn't want to be a liability.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_295.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_295.text: So be it. May Silvanus lend us nature's fury.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_295.context: NodeContext: Great resolve. Ready to march into battle.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_271.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_271.text: All right. Wait here until it's done.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_217.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_217.text: May Silvanus guide your hand. Focus on the leaders - that's all it will take to restore the balance here.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_309.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_309.text: You are aware you're asking me to kill a drow?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_212.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_212.text: You drow relish turning on your own, if there's something to be gained. Don't pretend otherwise.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_212.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a drow - 'please, don't pretend to be a bleeding heart' (prejudiced, but a common and often correct assessment of drow)

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_21.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_21.text: Not all drow are as you say.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_39.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_39.text: Unfair of me, perhaps, but I've had few encounters with drow to make me think otherwise.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_39.context: NodeContext: 'Prove me wrong. Save the innocents at the grove'

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_62.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_62.context: NodeContext: 'Prove me wrong. Save the innocents at the grove'

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_240.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_240.text: The grove isn't my problem. I have to concentrate on saving myself.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_182.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_182.text: I understand. You've done far more than most have for the grove, just by freeing me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_182.context: NodeContext: Stiff upper lip. He's crushed that the player won't help, but he maintains dignity

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_120.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_120.text: I cannot come with you, though I wish I could. At least let me tell you what I know; help you on your journey.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_129.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_129.text: Travelling to Moonrise is no small task. Expect dangers like you've never seen before.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_201.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_201.text: I'm something of an expert when it comes to imperilling myself.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_48.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_48.text: This is different. There's more fingers on a hand than there are survivors of that place.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_48.context: NodeContext: Deadly serious and speaking from personal experience, The place he's talking about is no joke.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_307.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_307.text: I think you're exaggerating. You just want me to stay and help you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_131.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_131.text: I do want you to help me, yes. But I am not exaggerating.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_173.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_173.text: To get to the Towers, you'll need to pass through a terrible place - a cursed place.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_154.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_154.text: This curse shrouds everything in shadow - you will not find life, light, or anything natural there.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_149.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_149.text: Any who linger are twisted by the curse; they become shadow beings - tormented, dangerous souls.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_220.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_220.text: Sounds like I've no choice - I need to find a way through.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_293.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_293.text: You're half right - you have to get to Moonrise, but you still have a choice of how to get there.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_163.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_163.text: The Absolute's forces can tolerate such a place?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_122.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_122.text: So it seems, though I don't know how. You will have to choose your approach carefully.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_194.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_194.text: There must be another way to cure myself.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_17.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_17.text: By all means - pursue any leads you may have. But I sense all roads will lead to Moonrise.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_209.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_209.text: You could go overland - along the Risen Road or through the mountains. Easier at first, but you'll run into the shadow curse eventually.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_98.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_98.text: You could also go under. There is a tunnel somewhere in this very temple of Selûne. It leads to Moonrise Towers through the Underdark.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_112.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_112.text: Long ago, a man called Ketheric Thorm built a secret stronghold deep down there, before rallying a whole army of Dark Justiciars - Shar worshippers.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_230.speaker: Shadowheart
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_230.text: Dark Justiciars? I must see for myself.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_9.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_9.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for a way down there - they were promised riches if they retrieved a relic called the Nightsong. But I think there's more.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_18.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_18.text: From this stronghold, Ketheric's forces could access both the temple of Selûne and Moonrise Towers - but he was defeated before he could launch an attack.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_312.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_312.text: If you can find this place, I'll wager it will reveal a more direct path to Moonrise Towers, and may bypass the worst of the shadow curse.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_275.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_275.text: I already found the place you're talking about - it's called Grymforge.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_275.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_165.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_165.text: You've already been? Impressive. You'll make me redundant at this rate. What did you find?
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_165.context: NodeContext: Impressed and a little amused at the player's diligence (finding a place before he can even tell them about it)

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_74.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_74.text: I found an elevator - but it leads right into the shadow curse.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_74.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player clicked the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_148.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_148.text: That sounds like what you need. But the next part of the journey mightn't be straightforward - or safe.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_183.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_183.text: Absolute followers - but that's about all.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_183.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't click the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_177.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_177.text: Keep looking. If they're present, then it's likely there's a route to Moonrise somewhere.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_160.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_160.text: Danger. Are you sure that's the best way to Moonrise?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_36.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_36.text: I'm certain. The Underdark is dangerous, yes, but the alternative is suicide. Be patient and be thorough - the path will reveal itself in time.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_102.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_102.text: It may prove impossible to avoid the shadow curse entirely, but if you find any way to limit your exposure, seize it.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_102.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_310.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_310.text: I've got more exploring to do.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_65.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_65.text: Tread carefully. You're on the right track, I'm sure - but there'll still be danger and difficulty before you reach Moonrise.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_10.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_10.text: I found the hidden entrance in the temple of Selûne - the way is clear.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_38.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_38.text: Already...? If only I'd gone with you instead of Aradin.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_298.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_298.text: I've already found a way into the Underdark. I can pick up the trail from there.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_67.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_67.text: So how do I find this underground route?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_187.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_187.text: You'll need to pick up where Aradin left off - find the hidden entrance. It's somewhere in these ruins, from what I've heard.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_283.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_283.text: One of the adventurers had a clue to help find it - a dwarf called Brian. It might still be found on his corpse, wherever the goblins left it.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_279.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_279.text: I don't want to risk getting lost in the Underdark - I'll journey overland.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_143.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_143.text: You may reconsider once you see the effects of the curse for yourself.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_137.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_137.text: How do I find this passage through the Underdark?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_53.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_53.text: Say I decide to try this Underdark route after all - how do I get started?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_157.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_157.text: What business do you have at Moonrise? You said you'd go there, if you could.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_223.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_223.text: My business there began long ago, and has led to a lifetime of regret.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_34.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_34.text: I helped overthrow Ketheric Thorm and his Dark Justiciars years ago. But I failed to prevent him from unleashing darkness across the region before he was defeated.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_251.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_251.text: I spent years researching the curse, trying to put an end to it. Nothing has worked - yet.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_228.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_228.text: If I could join you and get close to Moonrise, perhaps I could have both helped you find a cure for your infection and lifted the curse.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_13.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_13.text: But the grove must come first, I'm afraid.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_218.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_218.text: Is that why you went with Aradin? You thought he might uncover this route to Moonrise?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_43.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_43.text: Precisely. Then perhaps I could have done something about both the shadow curse and ceremorphosis aberrations.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_181.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_181.text: But in my eagerness, I put far too much faith in the abilities of Aradin and his band. We didn't even get close.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_276.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_276.text: One of those who died had a clue that was supposed to help us find the hidden entrance to the Underdark.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_159.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_159.text: A dwarf called Brian, I believe. Though there's no guarantee that the goblins left him recognisable.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_313.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_313.text: I may live to regret this - or maybe I won't - but fine, I'll help you save the grove first.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_176.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_176.text: You will? Oak Father bless you. I'll be in your debt twice over if we succeed.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_263.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_263.text: Now, there's no time to lose - get to the grove and help with the defences.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_174.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_174.text: You know what's needed - the deaths of Dror Ragzlin, the drow Minthara, and the priestess, Gut. May nature guide you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_8.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_8.text: I could come and help you... but be warned - I won't be able to suppress my animal side. Subtlety will not be an option.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_32.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_32.text: I'm sorry I can't do more. Thank you, and good luck with the grove.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_20.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_20.text: I'll need that luck, along with all the Oak Father's blessings.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_127.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_127.text: It seems the Absolute's forces are already marching on the grove. I'll have to try get ahead of them, do what I can.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_289.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_289.text: Farewell. I don't expect we'll meet again - at least not in this life.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_12.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_12.text: I'll remain here and do what I can to disrupt these cultists' plans. Perhaps I can stop their attack before it's even launched. Farewell.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_24.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_24.text: We're done here. I'll be on my way.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_86.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_86.text: I never thought I'd say this, but it sounds like the Underdark is the safer route.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_205.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_205.text: Anything is preferable to risking the shadow curse.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_40.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_40.text: I know the Underdark - it's lethal. I'll travel overland.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_238.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_238.text: The Underdark's my home. Better to take that route than risk this curse.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_306.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_306.text: The decision is yours, but I'd favour the Underdark. Even a place like that is the lesser evil compared to the shadow-cursed lands.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_221.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_221.text: This shadow curse - does it affect Shar worshippers?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_203.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_203.text: I don't know. Ketheric's followers were defeated or vanished before the effects of the curse took hold.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_234.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_234.text: Are these Sharrans still to be found?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_248.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_248.text: As bones, perhaps. But their hidden structures might still remain.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_237.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_237.text: How are you so sure Moonrise is where I have to go?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_139.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_139.text: Nature speaks to me. Birds report what they've seen. And I've overheard goblins speaking of it, too. Moonrise is at the heart of all this, I'm sure of it.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_126.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_126.text: Don't make it sound so tempting. I already know you'd rather I stayed and helped you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_247.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_247.text: That's true, I won't lie. But I won't let you march towards Moonrise without knowing what you'd face.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_179.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_179.text: Tell me, then. I'm going to do whatever it takes.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_256.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_256.text: True, but I mustn't be seen spilling drow blood. Stay here - I'll kill the trio quietly.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_84.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_84.text: Very well, but no witnesses can survive. We will kill this whole camp together.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_207.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_207.text: There's no pretence in not wanting to play the assassin. You're on your own.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_6.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_6.text: Best if I try settle this discreetly - wait here, and you'll have your deaths.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_259.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_259.text: Kagha was swayed by Shadow Druids. She nearly sealed the grove.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_193.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_193.text: Kagha... I should have suspected she'd take things too far. I'll deal with her when I can.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_193.context: NodeContext: Displeased yet not entirely surprised. He's going to read Kagha the riot act if he lives long enough to do so.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_188.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_188.text: But there are other matters to attend to before that.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_213.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_213.text: Kagha is dead. She was swayed by Shadow Druids. I had no choice.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_315.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_315.text: Kagha... This is my fault - I was her teacher. I will mourn her when I can.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_315.context: NodeContext: Processing the loss of his understudy, yet he knows she was in the wrong.  He bears no ill will to the player and doesn't have time to truly mourn while his mission is still ongoing

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_4.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_4.text: The other druids are dead, by my hand.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_132.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_132.text: What...? How? Why?! Explain yourself at once!

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_89.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_89.text: They left me no choice. I had to defend myself.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_239.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_239.text: Then... then it is as you say. They forgot their principles; you had no choice. I will mourn them when I can.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_239.context: NodeContext: Processing the loss of his comrades, yet he knows they were in the wrong.  He bears no ill will to the player and doesn't have time to truly mourn while his mission is still ongoing

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_317.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_317.text: I've explained all that I'm going to. Accept that or I'll give you the same treatment they got.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_64.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_64.text: You rabid dog. Murderer! Those were the servants of Silvanus - nature's guardians!
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_64.context: NodeContext: Incandescent with anger. Can hardly believe what he's hearing.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_103.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_103.text: You will not see another day.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_103.context: NodeContext: A cold, furious hiss. Combat breaks out immediately afterwards.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_109.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_109.text: It's who I am, who my mind makes me: a killer.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_104.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_104.text: And you... the way you speak... you're worse than the Absolutists here. At least they live with the pretence of purpose.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_272.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_272.text: Kagha carried out the Rite of Thorns - the grove has been sealed off from the world.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_291.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_291.context: NodeContext: Numb with shock. A catastrophe for Halsin - his home and sacred place of worship is basically lost to him forever.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_23.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_23.text: The grove is lost to me. To everyone. It's useless for me to stay here... there's nothing left to fight for.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_23.context: NodeContext: The fight goes out of him.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_253.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_253.text: I will find you at your camp, and help you with your problem. Right now, I... I need to go be alone.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_253.context: InternalNodeContext: Halsin to go off stage and reappear at the player camp. (New flag needed)NodeContext: Halsin leaves after this to process what's happened. He'll later reappear at the player's campsite.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_235.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_235.text: If you should have a chance to strike down the leaders of this horde, the world will be a better place for it. Farewell.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_235.context: InternalNodeContext: Halsin to go off stage and reappear at the player camp. (New flag needed)NodeContext: Halsin leaves after this to process what's happened. He'll later reappear at the player's campsite.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_22.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_22.text: Altered parasites? A cure at Moonrise Towers, maybe? Sounds like guesswork at best.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_82.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_82.text: I'm as certain as I can be. If you have a better alternative, I won't stop you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_262.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_262.text: I will help however I can. Let me see to some matters, then I will join you at your camp.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_197.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_197.text: Not that I'm eager to try stopping you, given the short work you made of the leadership here. With them dead, it's high time I got back to the grove.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_42.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_42.text: I can't stop you, in fact. Which brings me to my next problem...
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_42.context: NodeContext: Some hesitance in the second sentence. He's about to segue into asking a favour

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_281.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_281.text: At least I know what to do now. Thank you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_249.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_249.text: Wait. Now that the goblins' leaders are dead, I could join you - help you find a cure. I just need to make arrangements back at the grove. Find me there, if you wish.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_108.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_108.text: Wait - I could help you find a cure... but I need to settle matters here first.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_265.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_265.text: This magic isn't typical of how mind flayers procreate?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_200.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_200.text: No, this is different. Altered. The magic used is beyond me... it's either not of this world, or so ancient as to be lost to even nature's memory.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_59.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_59.text: So all of this was for nothing.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_314.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_314.text: Patience. I can't just snap my fingers... but I know where the solution almost certainly lies.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_171.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_171.text: You learned all this from your studies?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_216.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_216.text: Indeed. After we dealt with the drow that ambushed us, Nettie and I were able to inspect the corpse - and the creature that slithered out of it.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_100.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_100.text: How did you come to study mind flayer parasites?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_5.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_5.text: A drow forced me to defend myself. Afterwards, I was able to study the parasite that slithered out of the corpse, see what drives these 'True Souls'.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_140.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_140.text: I had no idea anyone beyond their ranks was infected. You have my sincere sympathies.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_150.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_150.text: Sympathies won't help me to survive.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_29.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_29.text: This magic you mentioned - it isn't normal for these parasites?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_169.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_169.text: Then everything we did here was hopeless.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_305.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_305.text: It's no coincidence that you found me here, I'll wager? You're after a cure for this parasite.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_87.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_87.text: The bear is a noble beast. I will not fear it, or abandon it.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_184.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_184.text: A jest - I truly am grateful. If only I could repay you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_51.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_51.text: You owe more than thanks, I think.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_226.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_226.text: Oh, certainly. But I live modestly at the best of times, and this is far from the best of times.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_226.context: NodeContext: 'Do I look like I have any gold to pay you?'

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_311.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_311.text: Perhaps there's something else I can offer you.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_277.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_277.text: Nature's blessings. I thought you'd be on your way by now... unless you changed your mind?

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_242.speaker: Player
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_242.text: I can't help you. I just need you to tell me about Moonrise Towers.

GroupDialogWithBear_97.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear_71.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear_71.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear_36.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_36.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear_27.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear_91.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear_81.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear_85.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear_85.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear_43.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_43.text: What the hells are you doing?

GroupDialogWithBear_93.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_93.text: We're juicing it up. The beast came in here with those robbers. Killed Dink - and Mince, too.
GroupDialogWithBear_93.context: NodeContext: first node surprised that you would stop her, as she thinks you're on her side. second node more annoyed.  She assumes that by explaining, you'll understand why they are hurting this woman.

GroupDialogWithBear_49.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_49.text: Boss's thinkin' of servin' it to the worgs.
GroupDialogWithBear_49.context: NodeContext: fyi, the worg cage is to the left of the cage that holds the bear. if the player is infront of the goblin mother, she might wave her right hand in that genirall direction.

GroupDialogWithBear_30.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear_30.context: NodeContext: Very excited. Not scared at all.

GroupDialogWithBear_10.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear_10.text: Look, look, you'll see. Gimme that rock. I'll show ya!
GroupDialogWithBear_10.context: NodeContext: the child is excited., he makes a sweep towards the ground picking up a stone in there hand. this will happen out of shot.

GroupDialogWithBear_72.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_72.text: Go on, then. Keep at it.

GroupDialogWithBear_59.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_59.text: What're ya - get lost if you can't stand a bit of rough-housin'.

GroupDialogWithBear_53.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] animal constructionsNodeContext: Speak with animals line

GroupDialogWithBear_4.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] animal constructionsNodeContext: SFX only - Halsin in bear form - do not voice record

GroupDialogWithBear_19.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear must lunges forward, to breaking down the gate
~The gate slams crushes mother goblin

GroupDialogWithBear_92.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_92.text: Throw a rock at the bear.

GroupDialogWithBear_78.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_78.text: Side with the freed bear - attack the goblin jailers.

GroupDialogWithBear_46.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_46.text: Leave the bear to the goblin's mercy.

GroupDialogWithBear_70.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_70.text: You chose. You die with them.
GroupDialogWithBear_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] animal constructionsNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

GroupDialogWithBear_82.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_82.context: NodeContext: SFX only - Halsin in bear form. Do not voice record.

GroupDialogWithBear_63.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_63.text: How about a taste of your own medicine?

GroupDialogWithBear_11.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_11.text: Release the bear immediately or face my wrath!

GroupDialogWithBear_44.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_44.text: All right, all right, if you're gonna throw a tantrum about it. Never seen someone so worked up over a stupid animal.

GroupDialogWithBear_47.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_47.text: We'll be the ones squealing if we piss off the bear-hugger.

GroupDialogWithBear_65.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_65.text: Hope you can control the furry bastard.

GroupDialogWithBear_75.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_75.text: It's stayin' right 'ere. The beast came in here with those robbers. Killed Dink - and Mince, too.

GroupDialogWithBear_51.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_51.text: Boss's thinkin' of servin' it to the worgs. But first, Three, more stones. Make it nice an' bloody.
GroupDialogWithBear_51.context: NodeContext: first node surprised that you would stop her, as she thinks you're on her side. second node more annoyed.  She assumes that by explaining, you'll understand why they are hurting this woman.

GroupDialogWithBear_89.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear_89.text: Yeah! Hit its head! I wanna hear more noises!

GroupDialogWithBear_8.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_8.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

GroupDialogWithBear_39.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_39.context: NodeContext: We're threathening her and she's having none of it.

GroupDialogWithBear_23.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_23.text: Go on, then. Aim for his eye.

GroupDialogWithBear_115.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_115.text: I'm putting an end to this. Now.

GroupDialogWithBear_96.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear rears up on it's hind legs (if possible, otherwise starts taking up more space) and roars in anger.NodeContext: Speak with animals line

GroupDialogWithBear_88.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear rears up on it's hind legs (if possible, otherwise starts taking up more space) and roars in anger.

GroupDialogWithBear_66.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_66.text: I - I mean no disrespect, just - these are the boss' orders. I can't let it out for no one but a True Soul.

GroupDialogWithBear_42.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_42.text: Then I'll just have to kill you.

GroupDialogWithBear_73.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_73.text: Fine. Do what you want with him.

GroupDialogWithBear_52.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_52.text: You will free the beast for me.

GroupDialogWithBear_58.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_58.text: You will free the beast for me.

GroupDialogWithBear_41.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_41.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

GroupDialogWithBear_28.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_28.text: Let him out. I'll take care of the beast.

GroupDialogWithBear_98.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_98.text: Oh, you're - uh, y-yes, of course.
GroupDialogWithBear_98.context: NodeContext: She just realised you are way higher in rank and she was talking down to you.

GroupDialogWithBear_57.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_57.text: Oh, y-you're also - Y-yes, of course.
GroupDialogWithBear_57.context: NodeContext: She just realised you are way higher in rank and she was talking down to you.

GroupDialogWithBear_77.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_77.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

GroupDialogWithBear_83.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_83.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... It's taking something you'll never get back.*

GroupDialogWithBear_50.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_50.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

GroupDialogWithBear_0.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_0.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

GroupDialogWithBear_13.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear_13.text: But - but I wanna hear it squeal!
GroupDialogWithBear_13.context: NodeContext: Put off and whiny - someone just told her to stop torturing the woman, and she doesn't like it.

GroupDialogWithBear_110.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear_110.text: One! That's a True Soul you're talkin' to. Show some respect!

GroupDialogWithBear_111.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear_111.text: S-sorry, True Soul. I'll open the cage for ya.
GroupDialogWithBear_111.context: NodeContext: She's talking to someone of much higher rank, and things didn't go smoothly. She's afraid of what you will do if she displeases you.

GroupDialogWithBear_103.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_103.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

GroupDialogWithBear_109.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_109.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'soon'.*

GroupDialogWithBear_67.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_67.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

GroupDialogWithBear_94.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_94.text: Let him out. I'll take care of the beast.

GroupDialogWithBear_55.speaker: Narrator
GroupDialogWithBear_55.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

GroupDialogWithBear_18.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_18.text: Sharper stones might cut through all that fur.

GroupDialogWithBear_100.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: Triumphant hump of excertion

GroupDialogWithBear_90.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear whimpers as the stone hits him and looks at us directly, as if begging us to help it.NodeContext: Speak with animals line

GroupDialogWithBear_69.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear whimpers as the stone hits him and looks at us directly, as if begging us to help it.

GroupDialogWithBear_64.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks at our backs as we turn away, as if begging us to help it.NodeContext: Speak with animals line

GroupDialogWithBear_45.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks at our backs as we turn away, as if begging us to help it.

GroupDialogWithBear_95.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_95.text: That's it. I'm putting a stop to this.

GroupDialogWithBear_17.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear_17.text: Throw a rock at the bear.

GroupDialogWithBear_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player picks up a rock and chucks it at the bear. The bear roars in anger.

GroupDialogWithBear_54.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear_54.text: You chose. You die with them.

Worg_001_0.speaker: Ferr
Worg_001_0.text: Smells big. Big belly. Big GUTS.

Worg_001_1.speaker: Ferr
Worg_001_1.text: Want it. Fur and meat. Kill it. KILL IT!
